troves.title: Resources for Introducing yourself to R and RStudio\"}
troves.description:
Overview of different online resources available for new, or learning, users to R and RStudio. <\\/h5>

<\\/h5>
A short summary is provided for each of the resources describing the content and style of delivery.<\\/h5>\"}

troves.title: Data Visualisation Examples\"}
troves.description: Examples of different graphical principles being used to maximise the potential of coveying information through data visualisation. Each example uses a real example, explains the rationale for choice of visualisation and provides R syntax of how to replicate a similar example.\"}

troves.title: Introduction to Analysis of Multi Environment Trials\"}
troves.description: Summary of methods for analysing results from multi environment trials. An appendix outlines R commands for replicating the results shown in the main document.\"}

troves.title: Analysis of Common Agricultural Designs in R 2\"}
troves.description: R tutorials covering standard analyses of data collected from standard on station experimental designs.\\r\\n\\r\\n[UNDER CONSTRUCTION ]\"}

troves.title: Sampling Decision Assistant\"}
troves.description:
The Sampling Decision Assistant was developed as a project for UNHCR in 2018. <\\/p>

The tool is designed to help with the design of sampling schemes. It is for sampling that is done to provide estimates of the values of characteristics of a population. Such studies are aimed at observing the population and measuring the factors of interest without trying to change anything. This type of study is used for things like profiling populations, setting baselines and assessing the value of indicators\\r\\n at midline or end-line points. \\r\\nThe decisions you make when designing this kind of study are about how you will sample the population.  \\r\\n<\\/p>

It is a website that guides the user through a sequence of decisions that eventually build a sampling scheme. The process can be started, saved and continued on a different session. It contains help about how to use the tool, explanation about statistical issues that are of importance when designing a sampling scheme and a sampling glossary.\\r\\n \\r\\n The resulting set of decisions can be downloaded as a printable file.<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: What is a representative sample?\"}
troves.description: A 2 min 37 seconds video in English explaining what are the main requirements to select a representative sample\"}

troves.title: Data Tree\"}
troves.description:
Data Tree is a free online course covering research data management, along with ways to engage and share data with business, policymakers, media and the wider public. It was created particularly for postgraduates, PhD students and early career researchers who want to learn research data management skills, but it can be helpful for researchers, scientists and anyone working with data. <\\/p>

\\r\\nStats4SD helped create Data Tree in cooperation with the Institute for Environmental Analytics (The IEA). The project was funded by the Natural Environment Research Council (NERC). \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

Data Tree Consists of 8 modules:\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

  1. Data Management: Context<\\/li>
  2. Data Management: Practicalities\\r\\n<\\/li>
  3. NERC\\r\\n4) Data Application: Analysis\\r\\n<\\/li>
  4. Data Application: Visualisation\\r\\n<\\/li>
  5. Working with Policy\\r\\n<\\/li>
  6. Working with Business\\r\\n<\\/li>
  7. Working with the Media and Public<\\/li><\\/ol>\"}

troves.title: RHoMIS - the Rural Household Multi-Indicator Survey\"}
troves.description:
RHoMIS - the Rural Household Multi-Indicator Survey\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

This is a survey that uses standardised indicators to characterise rural households. The main advantage of Rhomis is that it offers the user a questionnaire that includes indicators that have been tested and have been accepted as useful by a large number of users and stakeholders. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

Rhomis offers the ODK forms, the paper questionnaire and some R scripts to pre-process the data collected, but also there is the opportunity of support from the Rhomis team if the user accepts that the data they collect can become part of the multiple country database of rural households characteristics that Rhomis is building.\\r\\n\\r\\nAmong those indicators are the Food Insecurity Experience Scale (FIES), the Household Dietary Diversity Score (HDDS), the Hunger and Food Insecurity Access Scale (HFIAS), Food Availabilty (FA), and the Progress out of Poverty Index (PPI). All of these have further documentation available from elsewhere and need to be adpated to the context where the survey is to be conducted.\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

It is worth exporing their website for more information.<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Farm size and productivity: Lessons from recent literature\"}
troves.description: To be written by Ian!\"}

troves.description: A diagram of Stats4SD personnel and functions\"}

troves.title: Experiments with Farmers I - \\\"Why?\\\"\"}
troves.description:
This video introduces the idea of Experiments with Farmers and explores five reasons to involve farmers in your research process.\\r\\n<\\/p>

Written by Ric Coe\\r\\n
Designed by Emma Burrow\\r\\n
Narrated by Dave Mills<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Experiments with Farmers II - What happens to designs?\"}
troves.description:
This video explores the details of the way in which experiments with farmers could be designed, using a variety trial as an example. <\\/p>

Written by Ric Coe\\r\\n
Designed by Emma Burrow\\r\\n
Narrated by Dave Mills<\\/p>\"}
troves.elements_videos: {\"en\": \"[{\\\"path\\\":\\\"files\\\\/experiments-with-farmers-ii-what-happens-to-designs_2019-05-13_18:10:39\\\\/2019-05-13_18:10:39_experiments-with-farmers-ii-what-happens-to-designs.mp4\\\",\\\"temp_path\\\":\\\"files\\\\/experiments-with-farmers-ii-what-happens-to-designs_2019-05-13_18:10:39\\\\/2019-05-13_18:10:39_experiments-with-farmers-ii-what-happens-to-designs.mp4\\\",\\\"storedName\\\":\\\"2019-05-13_18:10:39_experiments-with-farmers-ii-what-happens-to-designs.mp4\\\",\\\"name\\\":\\\"Experiments with Farmers II - What happens to designs.mp4\\\",\\\"type\\\":\\\"mp4\\\",\\\"size\\\":33929364,\\\"type_id\\\":3}]\"}

troves.title: Experiments with Farmers III - \\\"From noise to information\\\"\"}
troves.description:
This video gives some examples of how to look at data from on-farm trials in a slightly different way, enabling you to get more information from the data. \\r\\n\\r\\nWe also discuss how to design your trial to make it as easy as possible to get useful and relevant information from the results. \\r\\n<\\/p>

Written by Ric Coe\\r\\n
Designed by Emma Burrow\\r\\n
Narrated by Dave Mills<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Experiments with Farmers IV - \\\"Farmers are not replicates!\\\"\"}
troves.description:
Replication is often a point of confusion for researchers. Often, researchers conducting on-farm trials will simply say \\\"the farms \\/ farmers are my replicates\\\" and leave it at that. \\r\\n\\r\\nThis video discusses why this is not a good idea, and why you need to think more carefully about where your replicates are in your design in order to be able to make sense of your results. <\\/p>

Written by Ric Coe\\r\\n
Designed by Emma Burrow\\r\\n
Narrated by Dave Mills<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Experiments with Farmers V - \\\"Communicating the design\\\"\"}
troves.description:
Communication is vital when conducting experiments with farmers. This video discusses some of the issues of how, why and particularly what to communicate when working with farmers. \\r\\n\\r\\nWe also make the case for a detailed written protocol to communicate the details of the design to yourself and others. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

Written by Ric Coe\\r\\n
Designed by Emma Burrow\\r\\n
Narrated by Dave Mills<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Designing Right-N Trials with Farmers - Week 1: \\\"The Objectives\\\"\"}
troves.description:
This webinar was given to a group of CCRP West Africa Grantees as part of the Research Methods Support Project.<\\/p>

Date of Recording: 19 May 2017. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

This is the first in a series of 4 webinars discussing the design of \\\"Right-N\\\" trials with farmers.<\\/p>


<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Designing Right-N Trials with Farmers - Week 2: \\\"Design Details\\\"\"}
troves.description:
This webinar was given to a group of CCRP West Africa Grantees as part of the Research Methods Support Project. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

Date of Recording: 26 May 2017. \\r\\n
Presented by: Ric Coe\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

This is the second in a series of 4 webinars discussing the design of \\\"Right-N\\\" trials with farmers.<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Designing Right-N Trials with Farmers - Week 3: \\\"Measurements\\\"\"}
troves.description:
This webinar was given to a group of CCRP West Africa Grantees as part of the Research Methods Support Project. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

Date of Recording: 02 June 2017. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

This is the third in a series of 4 webinars discussing the design of \\\"Right-N\\\" trials with farmers.<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Designing Right-N Trials with Farmers - Week 4: \\\"Implementation\\\"\"}
troves.description:
This webinar was given to a group of CCRP West Africa Grantees as part of the Research Methods Support Project. <\\/p>

Date of Recording: 09 June 2017. \\r\\n<\\/p>

Presented by: Ric Coe\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

This is the final video in a series of 4 webinars discussing the design of \\\"Right-N\\\" trials with farmers.<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: An Integrated Systems Approach to Research\"}
troves.description:
This is an abridged version of the paper: \\u2018An integrated agro-ecosystem and livelihood systems approach for the poor and vulnerable in dry areas.\\u2019 - Published in food security in 2013 by Van-Ginkel and other authors. <\\/p>

In these videos, Carlos Barahona explains the key points on how to take a \'systems-based\' approach to your study design, as described in the Van-Ginkel paper. We also provide a link to the original paper for reference.\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

This first video explores the current situation throughout much agricultural research, then guides you through an example \'systems\' diagram of a drylands system to help identify potential levers of change.<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Options by Context - The Concept\"}
troves.description: In this short video, Ric Coe introduces the concepts of options by context interactions by describing the more standard \\\"genotype by environment\\\" interactions that plant breeders use, and then generalising the idea.\"}

troves.title: Options by Context - The Design\"}
troves.description: This video discusses some of the issues surrounding the design of experiments when considering options by context interactions, including how to decide what \'options\' to test, and the contexts in which to test them.\"}

troves.title: Large N Trials - Concepts\"}
troves.description: These short videos introduce the concept of \\\"<span style=\\\"font-weight: bold;\\\">large-N<\\/span>\\\" trials. Ric Coe describes them in terms of more common concepts such as <span style=\\\"font-weight: bold;\\\">multi-environment<\\/span> and <span style=\\\"font-weight: bold;\\\">on-farm trials<\\/span>. \\r\\n\\r\\nThe first video explores the core concepts and how it can be a useful addition to the set of research tools available\"}

troves.title: An Infrastructure for Digital Data Collection\"}
troves.description:
This video gives an introduction to the sort of system(s) needed for running a project using digital data collection. \\r\\n\\r\\nThis includes surveys, collecting experiment data, market research. \\r\\n\\r\\nIt is intended as an \'eye-opener\' and touches on a lot of ideas.\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

This video was produced by the Statistical Services Centre, University of Reading, for the CRP-Dryland Systems Research Support Pack. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

The videos in this playlist are licensed licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.\\r\\n\\r\\nhttps:\\/\\/creativecommons.org\\/licenses\\/by-nc-sa\\/3.0\\/deed.en_GB<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Comments on the Infrastructure - Digital Data Collection\"}
troves.description: In this video, Carlos Barahona (Principal Statistician) and Andrew Pinney (Senior Statistician) discuss aspects of the infrastructure for a typical digital data collection and highlight some issues about the technology that project managers and team leaders might find useful. \\r\\n\\r\\nThese interviews were conducted in late Summer 2015, as part of a series of resources designed for researchers of the CRP-Drylands System.\"}

troves.title: Writing \\\"Smart\\\" Data Collection Forms\"}
troves.description:
In this video, Cathy Garlick (Senior Data Management Consultant) and Andrew Pinney (Senior Statistician) discuss issues about writing good forms. This includes both general questionnaire-writing tips and more specific suggestions for \\\"digital\\\" forms. <\\/p>

This video was produced by the Statistical Services Centre, University of Reading, for the CRP-Dryland Systems Research Support Pack. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

The videos in this playlist are licensed licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Conducting Interviews with Digital Data Collection Devices\"}
troves.description:
In this video, Carlos Barahona (Principal Statistician) and Andrew Pinney (Senior Statistician) discuss some issues surrounding the interview process when using digital devices. \\r\\n\\r\\nThis includes some suggestions on how to prevent the device itself forming a barrier between enumerator and respondent. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

These interviews were conducted in late Summer 2015, as part of a series of resources designed for researchers of the CRP-Drylands System.\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

This video was produced by the Statistical Services Centre, University of Reading, for the CRP-Dryland Systems Research Support Pack. \\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

The videos in this playlist are licensed licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.\\r\\n\\r\\nhttps:\\/\\/creativecommons.org\\/licenses\\/by-nc-sa\\/3.0\\/deed.en_GB<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Introduction to Dataverse\"}
troves.description: This video was produced by the Statistical Services Centre, University of Reading, for the CCAFS Data Management Support Pack. \\r\\n\\r\\nIt was written and narrated by Cathy Garlick, and produced by Cathy Garlick and Dave Mills.\\r\\n\\r\\nThe videos in this playlist are licensed licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.\"}

troves.title: Creating a Dataverse\"}
troves.description: This video was produced by the Statistical Services Centre, University of Reading, for the CCAFS Data Management Support Pack. \\r\\n\\r\\nIt was written and narrated by Cathy Garlick, and produced by Cathy Garlick and Dave Mills.\\r\\n\\r\\nThe videos in this playlist are licensed licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.\"}

troves.title: The CCAFS Dataverse (An Example Dataverse Project)\"}
troves.description:
This video was produced by the Statistical Services Centre, University of Reading, for the CCAFS Data Management Support Pack. \\r\\n\\r\\nIt was written and narrated by Cathy Garlick, and produced by Cathy Garlick and Dave Mills.\\r\\n<\\/p>

\\r\\nThe videos in this playlist are licensed licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.\\r\\n\\r\\nhttps:\\/\\/creativecommons.org\\/licenses\\/by-nc-sa\\/3.0\\/deed.en_GB<\\/p>

For more information about the Support pack, please visit the CCAFS website: \\r\\n\\r\\nhttps:\\/\\/ccafs.cgiar.org\\/data-management-support-pack<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Introduccion al manejo de datos en R\"}
troves.description:
Introduccion al manejo de datos en R (en espa\\u00f1ol). En esta sesion se ve:<\\/p>

  • Acceso al valor de una celda, de una fila y de una columna de un dataframe<\\/li>
  • Leer datos en formato csv<\\/li>
  • Ver los datos leidos<\\/li>
  • Calculos y creacion de nuevas columnas<\\/li>
  • Extraccion de un subconjunto de filas que cumplen una condicion\\r\\n<\\/li>
  • Extraccion de un subconjunto de filas<\\/li>
  • Datos faltantes: NA<\\/li>
  • Salvar un dataframe en formato csv\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/li><\\/ul>

    Se incluye:<\\/p>

    • Codigo R usado en la sesion<\\/li>
    • Datos usados en la sesion<\\/li>
    • Grabacion en video de la sesion<\\/li><\\/ul>\"}

troves.title: Ejercicio de introduccion al manejo de datos en R\"}
troves.description:
Ejercicio de manejo de datos basico en R (en espa\\u00f1ol).\\r\\n<\\/p>

Se incluye: <\\/p>

  • Enunciado del ejercicio\\r\\n<\\/li>
  • Datos para la resolucion del ejercicio (es el famoso dataframe \\\"iris\\\")<\\/li>
  • Codigo R de la resolucion de ejercicio<\\/li>
  • Grabacion en video de la sesion<\\/li><\\/ul>\"}

troves.title: Graficos basicos en R\"}
troves.description:
Graficos basicos en R (no usa librerias).\\r\\n<\\/p>

Se incluye: <\\/p>

  • Codigo R usado en la sesion<\\/li>
  • Datos usados en la sesion\\r\\n<\\/li>
  • Grabacion en video de la sesion<\\/li><\\/ul>\"}

troves.title: Rhomis implementation in Ecuador - CIP\"}
troves.description: This is an example of the implementation of Rhomis (see related resource) in Ecuador. The reserarcher, Israel Navarrete, agreed to sharing the questionnaire and XLS form for the ODK form.\"}

troves.title: Thinking in reverse order\"}
troves.description:
This is a PowerPoint presentation that illustrates the need to define the information needs before the instrument for collecting data is designed. A parallel is made with the process of making a cake. It seems to work well.\\r\\n<\\/p>

\\r\\nA version in English and a version in Spanish exist*. <\\/p>


<\\/p>

\\r\\n\\r\\n<\\/p>

* Some work is needed to separate the language versions<\\/p>\"}

troves.title: Studies to estimate population characteristics versus studies to compare interventions\"}
troves.description: A two-minute animated video explaining the difference between studies that aim to estimate characteristics of a population and studies to compare interventions.\\r\\n\\r\\nOriginally created for UNHCR as part of the FAQ section to support use of the Sampling Decision Assistant Tool.\"}

troves.title: Limitations of results from non-representative samples\"}

collections.title: Experiments with Farmers
collections.description:
Making research genuinely participatory is a complex process. Despite 30 years of ‘participatory’ research, this label often means farmers not contributing much more than free labour, with researchers doing everything else. 

Ways of making research more participatory have been discussed from an institutional and a social perspective, so these videos focus on the technical issues surrounding truly participatory research. 

We discuss the implications of farmers helping to design experiments (for example, by choosing treatments). We also explore ideas on participatory analysis and other activities that farmers can be involved in during the research.

collections.title: Designing \"Right-N\" Trials - Webinar Series
collections.description:
These webinars were given by the RMS team as a response to a request from the West Africa Community of Practice (CoP), from the CCRP project.

In these 4 webinars, Ric Coe explores some of the key points about the process of designing "Right-N" trials with farmers, including what "Right-N" actually means!

The webinars include discussion of important practical considerations, how to answer important questions like what to measure, how to take measurements etc. 

Ric also explains how vital your communication with the farmers is. If you are going to get farmers involved in managing your experiments, they have to be fully involved in each step, and have a feeling of ownership about the process. This is not easy to achieve, but it is possible with good communication. The final webinar in this series focuses specifically on this topic of communication.

collections.title: Frameworks for agroecology assessment
collections.description:
A collection of resources that can be used to assess the use of agroecological principles. Useful to guide the work of planning, assessing or evaluating how agroecological principles or practices are being used. Each resource is also loaded to the resource bank as a separate trove.

Each resource is tagged into one of 3 categories:

frameworks - the high level conceptual ideas to inform assessment methods

methodology - specific tools and methodologies for assessment

review - review or suggestions for assessment

A listing of the resources in this collection can be found here:

https://stats4sd.org/download/ae-frameworks-listing_2019-07-12_15:52:52/2019-07-12_15:52:52_ae-frameworks-collection.xlsx/AE%20Frameworks%20Collection.xlsx


A brief summary of each resource is provided, along with some editorial comments on the usage and relevance of the resources for a CCRP context.

collections.title: CCRP Front Page Resources
collections.description: This is a set of resources we promote on the main CCRP landing page. They are either resources developed specifically to support our work with grantees and the wider programme, or resources we feel would be useful for CCRP.

collections.title: Análisis de textos usando R
collections.description: Esta collección contiene la guía en español para RQDR, el video un webinario sobre análisis de textos y el archivo de PowerPoint usado para el webinario.\r\n\r\nEsta colección puede ser útil para personas que esten interesadas en una discusion de nivel intermedio sobre análisis de textos usando software, y que quieran probar usar la librería de R (RQDA) que hace ese tipo de análisis.

collections.title: Digital Data Collection - Opportunities and Challenges
collections.description:
This collection of resources covers a wide range of topics relating to digital data collection. These were originally developed for the CGIAR Research Program on Dryland Systems (CRP-DS) in 2015. 


In the videos, we interviewed a small team of data managers and statisticians, who reflect on their real-world experience of designing, building and using digital data forms to collect data across many projects, including for research and monitoring and evaluation purposes. The overall message is that digital tools for data collection are extremely powerful, but moving to use them instead of paper will (and should!) change the way you approach a collection project.

collections.title: Statistical Good Practice Guides
collections.description:
A series of guides covering the statistical aspects of research projects, aimed at research scientists who may not be very familiar with statistical concepts. An understanding of statistical ideas can save time and money for research projects, and result in more informative research outputs.

The guides were created by The University of Reading Statistical Services Centre, and were originally written as part of a contract with DFID to give guidance to research and support staff working on DFID Natural Resources projects. They provide guidelines for staff involved in the development and presentation of research projects. The guidelines are intended to help researchers to identify their biometric or statistical needs.

collections.title: Webinars del Seminario Metodologías para la Investigación en Agroecología CCRP/CLACSO
collections.description:
El seminario "Metodologías para la investigación en agroecología" consiste en una serie temas que se consideran útiles para iniciar una discusión sobre algunos enfoques y métodos de investigación con estudiantes de doctorado y maestría en temas relacionados con la agroecología.

Los estudiantes para quienes se prepararon estos temas han recibido apoyo para su trabajo de campo del Programa Colaborativo de Investigación de Cultivos (CCRP) Región de los Andes, de la Fundación McKnight. Este apoyo incluye financiamiento para algunas actividades de campo, apoyo de tutores de CLACSO, financiamiento para el establecimiento de una comunidad de práctica de los estudiantes para intercambiar experiencias y la participación en una serie de seminarios, de los cuales este es el primero. El seminario también está abierto a otras personas que no han recibido este financiamiento pues tanto CLACSO como el CCRP quieren ser tan abiertos e inclusivos como sea posible.

El seminario incluye una serie de temas ligados a como pensamos o hacemos investigación. Algunos son más generales otros más específicos, pero todos están pensados para motivar discusión, reflexión y desafíos a la forma como conducimos investigación o tratamos los datos que se derivan de ella.

collections.title: FRN Process - Collect and Handle Data
collections.description:
FRN Process step 4 -

  • Collect data
  • Test options
  • Manage data

collections.title: FRN Process - Engage
collections.description:
The 'engage' step in the FRN process involves sharing the ideas and vision behind FRNs, engaging farmers in the process, and initiating working relationships with stakeholders and partners.

In this section, you will find tools and guides aimed at helping understand and facilitate this process.

Highlights

Here are some of our favourite items from the collection:

  • The Global Community Action Guides contain a wealth of practical information that will be invaluable in setting up any participatory research group, and throughout the research process. It also provides further tools, templates and suggested activities that could be adapted for use with FRNs.
  • The short guides from the Best Bets project cover topics throughout the FRN process. The ones at this step focus on engaging and selecting farmers to work with, and (in French only at the moment) getting the community involved and setting up an experiment.

Get Involved

If you've used any of the resources in this collection, we'd love to know what you think! Get in touch and tell us about your experience.

We're always looking to add to this collection. If you have any favourite guides, tools or other resources related to this step that you'd like to share, send us a message to tell us about it.

collections.title: FRN Process - Prioritize
collections.description:
This step is about understanding the local context, knowledge and values and combining that with global academic knowledge to identify options, facilitate decision-making and design research that takes into account the diverse range of interests, priorities and capacities within an FRN.

Highlights

Here are some favourite items from the collection:

  • The FRN diagnosis and planning exercise is a great example of an activity plan that can be adapted for use in different context, and which gives a good starting point for gaining an understanding of local context.

Get Involved

If you've used any of the resources in this collection, we'd love to know what you think! Get in touch and tell us about your experience.

We're always looking to add to the collection. If you have any favourite guides, tools or other resources related to this step that you'd like to share, send us a message to tell us about it.

collections.title: FRN Process - Design
collections.description:
This step is about applying principles to facilitate the design of experiments for participatory research.

It involves choosing technology and methodologies that are appropriate for farmer involvement, and building capacity to enable farmers to take an active role in research activities. Participatory experimental design must take into account the interests and priorities of farmers and community groups.

Highlights

Here are some favourites from this collection:
  • Principles of experimentation that farmers need to understand - this resource concisely summarises the concepts farmers need to be familiar with to take part in research activities. It is up to individual groups to decide how best to facilitate an understanding of these principles within their network. If you have used this resource, we'd be really interested to hear from you about how you applied it in an participatory research context. Use the contact form to get in touch.
  • Designing Participatory On-Farm Experiments: Resources for Training: This handbook is a valuable source of information for training people with experience in research or extension on how to facilitate participatory research. It contains lots of useful training material on participatory experimental design.

Get Involved

If you've used any of the resources in this collection, we'd love to know what you think! Get in touch and tell us about your experience.

We're always looking to add to the collection. If you have any favourite guides, tools or other resources related to this step that you'd like to share, send us a message to tell us about it.

collections.title: Soil
collections.description: A collection of resources focused on soil health. This includes methods of maintaining, improving and protecting soil, and information about farmer-inclusive soil heath assessment and evaluation.

collections.title: FRN - Agroecology Techniques
collections.description:
Agroecology-related resources relevant to FRNs and those working with them.

Includes case studies and practical guides.

collections.title: FRN - Pest Management
collections.description:
Resources on weed and pest management, relevant for FRNs and those working with them.

Includes information on Striga, Fall Armyworm, and botanical pesticides.

collections.title: Gender
collections.description: FRN relsvant resources focused on women\'s equality and gender issues.

collections.title: Farmer Participation and Networks
collections.description: A collection of more general guides and handbooks which provide an overview to participatory research, farmer research networks and community-led research.

collections.title: FRNs - Evaluation
collections.description: Evaluation-related resources, including developmental evaluation.

collections.title: Local Knowledge
collections.description: Resources that concern farmers\' local and traditional knowledge, and how this can be brought into dialogue with researchers and scientific knowledge systems.
